sentence.Network_en: The squatter settlements originally came into being through illegal land invasions.
sentence.Network_cn: 违章建筑区最初是通过非法的土地占有而形成的.

sentence.Network_en: Squatter control is maintained by regular patrols and hut - to - hut checks.
sentence.Network_cn: 当局定期逐户视察所有寮屋,以收管制之效.

sentence.Network_en: Land claimed by a settler or squatter, especially under the Homestead Act.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一个新的地域中的首批殖民者或定居者.

entry.def: A squatter is someone who lives in an unused building without having a legal right to do so and without paying any rent or any property tax.
A squatter is someone who occupies unused land, either to farm it or to build a house on it, without having a legal right to do so.

example.ex: When they returned to Tuol Sakor, they found all the best land taken by squatters.
example.tran: 当回到图尔沙科尔时，他们发现那些最好的土地全都被人侵占了。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who settles lawfully on government land with the intent to acquire title to it
2. someone who settles on land without right or title
